comments.body: "As you peruse" comes as a surprise—what am I perusing? I think a note in the first paragraph that you can dive into sub-directories (especially `salt/`) for lots more information would help people know where to look for further documentation. (I worry that a project newbie wouldn't know specifically to look in `cluster/saltbase/salt/` to find the detailed docs you just wrote!)
I actually originally had each directory described, then I realized they belonged in readmes in the directory below. Not sure how to make it the most visible.
A tiny brief overview, like a table of contents, would at least let people know there's more to come and where to loook
I added a little tiny thing, but there's a silly tension here between duplicating the exact same content that's already on the screen, and not.

I see what you mean. I made the above comment before knowing much about salt. Now that I've read some amount of salt documentation, I see that `salt/`, `pillar/`, and `reactor/` are the three main directory trees of salt, so perusing into those specifics is obvious if you know what you're looking for. If you don't know about salt, they seem like completely arbitrary names, and one is immediately motivated to move a directory up and not keep looking.

I guess it depends who you're writing this documentation for. If it's people that know about salt, you needn't say anything more. If it's for salt newbies, some motivation for looking further is needed.

Anyway, I think the links you've added give a nice balance, so this looks good. Just wanted to provide a bit of context that may seem obvious for someone who is knee deep in salt.
